author: tbenr
content:
https://dora.fusaka-devnet-3.ethpandaops.io/slot/0xa7e61546b6ccea3b8ac4904200c44c74b1b3dbfd198ba5cf08b942f0efda6554

author: manunlp
content:
Saw the same from Prysm point of view. Got ~3k requests for this block in ~25 min range: https://gist.github.com/nalepae/0c9390cf71249eff815358f6826958c8

Mainly coming from this peer: `16Uiu2HAmLyapMNMX9gRSZX3cMm58snMiyYfKSUu7ZzQDHkJ1cxah` which is a LH peer:
```
Initiate peer connection activePeers=56 agent=Lighthouse/v7.1.0-438fb65/x86_64-linux direction=Inbound multiAddr=/ip4/159.65.60.119/tcp/9000/p2p/16Uiu2HAmLyapMNMX9gRSZX3cMm58snMiyYfKSUu7ZzQDHkJ1cxah
```

author: manunlp
content: However this is not an "official" LH peer according to dora. Maybe a malicious one?
